images.title: < Select electronic design >
Dual Battery Controller, Page 1
images.description: This is the schematic for the dual battery controller. The controller is designed to manage the charging of an auxillary battery in a vehicle. This page shows the battery controller. It works by starting a timer (IC5) when the ignition is on, the starter motor has come on and gone off, and the auxillary batter is present. After the time period elapses the relay drive excites the Solenoid-Control-OUT lead, which switches the batteries together.

images.title: Dual Battery Controller, Page 2
images.description: This is the schematic for the battery meters. The battery meterss are designed to give a quickly observed picture of each battery's condition. It works by feeding the raw battery voltage levels to the bar display drivers IC6 and IC7. The high-voltage and low-voltage thresholds can be trimmed with two variable resistor trimmers. The threshold voltages are stabilised by a zener diode D15 and voltage spikes are suppressed by capacitors C6, C7, C8 and C9.

images.title: Dual Battery Controller
images.description: This is the layout for the dual battery controller and battery meter PCBs. The controller is designed to manage the charging of an auxillary battery in a vehicle and the battery mneter is a bar graph display of batter condition. Each board is double-sided and the two boards are designed to be connected with a simple four-pin connector.

Livelihood Zones (A3 size image) in South Africa
images.description: Livelihood zones are areas where people have similar patterns of making a living. In each zone, people share similar options for making a living, such as farming, fishing, or herding. The zones are based on the type of land, the climate, and the plants and animals that live there. This map shows the livelihood zones in the country. The zones are based on the type of land, the climate, and the plants and animals that live there.

images.title: Remote Sensing Vegetation Condition Index
images.description: The Vegetation Condition Index (VCI) is a measure of how healthy the plants are. It shows how much the plants are growing compared with the average for that time of year. The VCI is based on satellite images that measure the amount of green in the landscape. This map shows the VCI for the whole country.

images.title: Remote Sensing Vegetation Condition Index with Hazard Areas Defined
images.description: The pixels making up the Vegentation Condition Index raster map have been aggregated and combined to form a vector Harard Area Definition map. The hazard area is defined as the area where the VCI is below 35%.

images.title: Hazard Affected Areas
images.description: The hazard affected areas are the areas where the VCI is below 35%. This map shows the aggregated hazard affected areas across the country.
